docs.title: Home
docs.text: This is hosted in GitHub Pages. Happy Reading.

docs.title: How To Deploy
docs.text: Only manual deployment is supported. GitHub Pages for private repositories is not available for free tier.

docs.title: 1. Add Remote [Only Once]
docs.text: git remote add docs https://github.com/Solenergy-Systems-Inc/envision-utility-backend-docs.git

docs.title: 2. Deploy
docs.text: mkdocs gh-deploy -r docs

docs.title: [POST] resolveAlarm

docs.title: ResolveAlarmRequestDTO
docs.text:

Attributes:

unique ID of an alarm

unique ID of a site

unique ID of a device

docs.title: [GET] powerPrediction
docs.text: /api/generationForecast/powerPrediction

docs.title: RequestDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description site_id int hour_ahead float pht_date date

docs.title: ResponseDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description prediction List[Tuple[UtilityDateTime, Any, Any, Any]]

FOR START TIME TO CURRENT TIME: THIS FOLLOWS [dt, actual, forecast, percent_error] FOR CURRENT TIME TO END TIME: THIS FOLLOWS [dt, error_low, forecast, error_high]

statistics ResponseStatisticsDTO

docs.title: ResponseStatisticsDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description daily_energy RoundedFloat(2) mean_average_percentage RoundedFloat(2) peak_power RoundedFloat(2) perc95 RoundedFloat(2) predicted_15min RoundedFloat(2) predicted_5min RoundedFloat(2) predicted_energy RoundedFloat(2) predicted_peak RoundedFloat(2)

docs.title: ActiveAlarmDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description alarm_id str

unique identifier for the alarm

site_id str

site_id where the alarm was detected

time_detected str

alarm_source str

error_code str

error_message str

error message of the alarm

severity str

severity of the alarm

Name Type Description project_id str

id of the project

start_date str

start date of the resolved alarms to be retrieved in the format of YYYY-MM-DD

docs.text:

Name Type Description alarm_id int

id of the alarm

time_detected str

frequency int

docs.title: [GET] feederMap
docs.text: /api/monitoring/feederMap

docs.title: FeederMapRequestDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description site_id str

id of the site

docs.title: FeederMapResponseDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description meter MeterDetailsDTO

MeterDetailsDTO of the main meter

transformer MeterDetailsDTO

MeterDetailsDTO of the outgoing meter

feeder_meters List[MeterDetailsDTO]

list of MeterDetailsDTO

docs.title: MeterDetailsDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description name str

name of the meter

status str

status of the meter

docs.title: How it's different from the old implementation:
docs.text: • The return parameters are different. Previously, we used to assign the transformer to the outgoing_meter parameter and had the meter in the main_meter parameter. The problem is that both words mean the same thing so it is now revised to just meter and transformer while the feeder_meters stay the same.

docs.title: [GET] inverterInfo
docs.text: /api/monitoring/inverterInfo

docs.title: InverterInfoRequestDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description inverter_id str

device ID of the inverter from which the information will be retrieved

docs.title: InverterInfoResponseDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description inverter_station_info InverterStationInfoDTO

information of the inverter station in the format of InverterStationInfoDTO

inverter_info InverterInfoDTO

information of the inverter in the format of InverterInfoDTO

scb_list List[SCBInfoDTO]

list of SCB information in the format of SCBInfoDTO

docs.title: InverterStationInfoDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description kw_reading Union[float, None]

reading of the inverter station in kilowatts

status DeviceStatusEnum

status of the inverter station in the format of DeviceStatusEnum

reading_date str

date of the reading in the format of YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS

docs.title: InverterInfoDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description kw_reading Union[float, None]

reading of the inverter station in kilowatts

status DeviceStatusEnum

status of the inverter station in the format of DeviceStatusEnum

reading_date str

date of the reading in the format of YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS

docs.title: SCBInfoDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description scb_id int

device id of the SCB

scb_name str

name of the scb device

power Union[float, None]

power of the SCB in kW

temp bool

flag to determine if the SCB has a temperature related error

volt bool

flag to determine if the SCB has a voltage related error

current bool

flag to determine if the SCB has a current related error

channels dict

dictionary of the channels of the SCB and their corresponding color coded errors

docs.title: DeviceStatusEnum
docs.text:
Bases: str, Enum

Attributes:

Name Type Description Online

The last reading of the device is within the last 10 minutes

Offline

The last reading of the device is more than 15 minutes ago

Error

The last reading of the device is more than 10 minutes ago but less than 15 minutes

docs.title: [GET] weatherData
docs.text: /api/monitoring/weatherData

end_date Annotated[Union[str, datetime], AfterValidator(phtEndDateToUTCDatetime)]

end date in the format of 'YYYY-MM-DD'

docs.title: WeatherDataResponseDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description weather_morning str

weather forecast for the morning

weather_afternoon str

weather forecast for the afternoon

additional parameters

docs.title: WeatherParametersDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description irradiance Optional[float] relative_humidity Optional[float] wind_speed Optional[float] module_temp Optional[float]

docs.title: Expected error messages:
docs.text: • SITE_DOES_NOT_EXIST: The site id given does not match any of the registered sites

docs.title: [POST] login
docs.text: /api/login

docs.title: LoginRequestDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description login_type LoginTypeEnum

LoginTypeEnum

email str

email of the user

password str

password of the user

docs.title: LoginTypeEnum
docs.text:
Bases: str, Enum

Attributes:

Name Type Description WEB

used web to login

MOBILE

used mobile to login

docs.title: LoginResponseDTO
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Attributes:

Name Type Description project_id int

project id assigned to the user

site_id int

site id assigned to the user

email str

email of the user

fail_login int

number of failed login attempts

id_user int

user id

master_account int

boolean flag if the user is a master user

project_name str

name of the project

hierarchy dict

hierarchy of the devices installed in the site (top-down)

user_type str

UserTypeEnum

token str

authentication token to be used for future requests

profile_picture Optional[str]

URL of the user's profile picture

docs.title: UserTypeEnum
docs.text:
Bases: str, Enum

Attributes:

Name Type Description basic

Can only view live data. No sitesOverview or plant generation. Has historical data but can't backtrack, has weather forecast

executive

All basic features and statistics and historical backtracking.

technical

reserved for engineers who are not part of our O&M team. Can view errors / alarms sent by devices installed on site

maintenance

reserved for O&M team. Can access all features of envision utility

docs.title: Important Note:
docs.text: Request is expected to be a form-data request.
